Text: Thanks legolash2o for the AIO!!

No activation or serial, i was trying to make it 'untouched' as much as possible but i had to use vLite so i could fit it all on one disk :)
What all did you have to take out?

I was wondering how you did this. I was trying myself. I want to do a full AIO with SP1 but fully untouched. I don't care how big it is because it will be going on an USB stick. I install all my windows 7's via usb anyway...so I wouldn't have to take stuff out with vlite

What i took is listed in the description where it says 'vLite Preset', the latest RT7Lite Beta lets you integrate service packs but to do each one takes time :P

Running ServicePack1.exe /X extracts the cab from within the exe also.

I was using RT7lite 2.6 beta...but I kept getting errors after about 30 mins of integrating the SP...I'll try again later...what I was wanting to know tho is how to get both x86 and x64 on one install...Thanks!!
I'm also wanting to create an AIO like this but with Enterprise also

Why try to fit all into DVD when there is DVD-DL.
Double size and all DVD burners are compatible. The extra price in not ever worth to mention...

But - thanks for your work...
